title: Ticket #7690: Deprecate old, bad Python interfaces
description: Deprecate the old event log reader and current job log reader classes (broken), as well as the old negotiator object (?).
remarks:
2020-Jun-16 15:51:37 by tlmiller:
Asking JoshK to review the implementation since this degree of Python sorcery is beyond my comfort level. :)

2020-Jun-16 16:14:11 by tlmiller:
TJ, is htcondor.lock() also broken? Should we avoid deprecating it?

2020-Jun-17 11:28:55 by karpel:
Code Review

I get a build failure, probably related to the make install changes: 

FAILED: bindings/python/build/timestamp
cd /home/build/build/bindings/python && /usr/bin/python2 /home/build/build/bindings/python/setup.py build && /usr/bin/cmake3 -E touch /home/build/build/bindings/python/build/timestamp
/usr/bin/python2: can't open file '/home/build/build/bindings/python/setup.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory

  • I think the submodule should have a leading underscore in its name, since we don't intend end-users to import it.
  • The deprecate decorator needs to use functools.wraps as well, and that means it probably needs the assigned trick too. We should factor the assigned stuff out into a helper and re-use it here and in _lock.py. In fact, I think deprecate_method can probably just be a wrapper around deprecate, to further reduce code duplication.
  • The deprecation warning messages should be more specific. Language like "Deprecated; will be removed in vX.Y.Z; replaced by foo.bar".
  • I'm not convinced we can mark the un-constructable classes like this - I suspect the internal bindings code won't see these wrappers at all. We need to mark the methods that create those objects deprecated instead.
  • I recommend running black over this (I'd like us to be running black over all new Python code, where reasonable).

2020-Jun-23 18:15:22 by tlmiller:
Regarding documentation:

AFAICT:

  • hcondor.FileLock is not documented.
  • htcondor.EventIterator is mentioned in the scalable job tracking page, but not documented.
  • htcondor.LogReader is not documented.
  • htcondor.lock is not documented.
  • htcondor.read_events is mentioned in the scalable job tracking page, but not documented.

I have marked htcondor.Negotiator as deprecated, although we may want to reverse that before release; I think htcondor.Schedd.negotiate() is what everyone was worried about, but I don't recall at this point.

I will rewrite the scalable job tracking page as a different ticket, because yay for interactive tutorials.
